article_text: Barrels are strewn about inside the storage room of Bouchaine Vineyards in downtown Napa, Calif., after a 6.0-magnitude earthquake struck the area north of San Francisco at 3:20 a.m. PDT Sunday. The quake caused damage to roads and buildings, ignited fires and sent more than 100 people to a hospital with non-life threatening injuries — prompting California's governor Jerry Brown to declare a state of emergency. Josh Edelson/AFP/Getty Images

article_metadata.title: Photos: Earthquake Shakes Northern California

og.description: More than 100 were injured after the strongest quake to hit the San Francisco area in 25 years damaged homes, wineries and historic buildings.

article_summary:
Barrels are strewn about inside the storage room of Bouchaine Vineyards in downtown Napa, Calif., after a 6.0-magnitude earthquake struck the area north of San Francisco at 3:20 a.m. PDT Sunday.
The quake caused damage to roads and buildings, ignited fires and sent more than 100 people to a hospital with non-life threatening injuries — prompting California's governor Jerry Brown to declare a state of emergency.
Josh Edelson/AFP/Getty Images
